symbols.docstring: [PHPCSUtils][phpcsutils-repo] is a set of utilities to aid developers of sniffs for [PHP_CodeSniffer] (or "PHPCS" for short).
symbols.name: Features

symbols.docstring: * PHP 5.4 or higher. * [PHP_CodeSniffer] 3.13.5+/4.0.1+. * Recommended PHP extensions for optimal functionality: - PCRE with Unicode support (normally
symbols.name: Minimum Requirements

children.docstring: If your unit tests use the PHP_CodeSniffer native unit test suite, all is good.
children.name: Running your unit tests

children.docstring: If your external PHP_CodeSniffer standard only supports Composer-based installs, integrating PHPCSUtils is pretty straight forward.
children.name: Composer-based

children.docstring: To support non-Composer based installs for running your sniff unit tests, you will need to adjust the PHPUnit `bootstrap.php` file to allow for passin
children.name: Running your unit tests

children.docstring: In this case, more than anything, you will need to update the non-Composer installation instructions for your end-users.
children.name: Non-Composer based integration

symbols.name: Integrating PHPCSUtils in your external PHPCS standard

children.docstring: A: As PHPCSUtils is registered with PHPCS as an external standard and PHPCSUtils complies with the naming requirements of PHPCS, the PHPCS native auto
children.name: Q: How does this all work without an external standard needing to register an autoloader?

children.docstring: A: No. PHPCSUtils will only work for those sniffs which explicitly use the PHPCSUtils functionality.
children.name: Q: Does using PHPCSUtils have any effect on the PHPCS native sniffs?

children.docstring: A: JS/CSS support will be removed from `PHP_CodeSniffer` in PHPCS 4.x. While at this time, some of the utilities _may_ work with JS/CSS files, PHPCSUt
children.name: Q: Do the utilities work with javascript/CSS files?

children.docstring: A: No. The UTF-8 file encoding is the only officially supported encoding. Support for other encodings may incidentally work, but is not officially sup
children.name: Q: Are all file encodings supported?

children.docstring: 1. Check that the version of PHPCSUtils the user has installed complies with the minimum version of PHPCSUtils your standard requires. If not, they wi
children.name: Q: A user reports a fatal "class not found" error for a class from PHPCSUtils

symbols.name: Potential Support Questions from your End-Users
